results.title: ML Engineer Intern
results.description:
At Ivy, we’re on a mission to unify all Machine Learning (ML) frameworks, making ML code cleaner, more flexible, and fully reusable. All Ivy functions can be executed using TensorFlow, PyTorch, MXNet, JAX and NumPy, without any change to the code.

We've just raised a round of venture funding (YC, Abstraction, Essence, A Capital). We’re looking for talented developers to join this ambitious endeavor, just as we’re getting started. Hop on board and lets-unify.ai!


We are in talks with developers from Google, Facebook, NVIDIA, Hugging Face, and other top software companies who would like to use Ivy in their popular open-source projects, to instantly support all frameworks. A few examples are: Ray, FastAI, Transformers, PyG, Pyro, Kornia.


Role

We are looking for developers to join our team remotely for 3-12 months with flexible start dates. You will help to extend Ivy’s codebase as we expand into the PyTorch Ecosystem and beyond. The monthly salary will be $2500-4000 depending on experience. We are hiring worldwide, no visa required. During the role, your tasks would include:


● Helping to design Ivy's graph compiler and transpiler, enabling automatic code conversions between frameworks

● Working alongside our open-source partners, helping to incorporate Ivy into their popular repositories

● Implementing SOTA models in Ivy, and adding these to our model hub


Requirements

● Strong Python skills, with expertise in one of: PyTorch, TensorFlow, JAX

● Strong skills in recursive programming. Check out the Ivy Container class

● A passion for Machine Learning research, and for our vision to unify the ML frameworks!


Application Instructions

After clicking the apply button, please check your spam, promotion and junk folders every few days. Unfortunately some of our emails are ending up there. We are working hard to fix this asap.

If you have any questions in the meantime, please reach out on the "Join our Team" channel (or direct message the IvyTeam account) in our discord server!

We really look forward to hearing from you! :)

results.title: New Business Strategy, MBA Internship (Summer 2023)
results.description:
Lincoln Avenue Capital is seeking a New Business Strategy intern to join our firm this summer. This individual will be responsible for working with our Executive-level team on sourcing, analyzing, structuring, and financing new business opportunities in the real estate investment space. As a 10–12-week paid Summer Internship, this is an opportunity to develop critical business acumen and skills as you build long-term growth plans that have the potential to impact our business and mission for years to come. Through our dynamic program, you will gain practical and hands-on experience to help you meet your educational goals and prepare you for a real estate, finance, or private equity career.

At this time, we are only considering MBA students who are graduating in Spring 2024.

 

What You'll Do

  • Conduct primary research on expansion opportunities in any market.
  • Lead the development of a long-term growth plan and underwriting standards.
  • Determine the strengths and weaknesses of various new business opportunities while considering the impact on the Founders' overall investment strategy and social impact goals.
  • Work with the Executive team to create recommendations for market expansion and large-scale investment opportunities.
  • Present recommendations to the investment committee with oversight from senior leaders, including LAC's Co-Founders.
  • Investigate and analyze market rules, regulations, industry trends, or other documents.
  • Analytical tasks including modeling of investment opportunities.

Requirements

  • MBA candidate (Spring 2024) with exceptional academic performance and experience in finance and/or real estate.
  • Real estate, private equity, or structured credit experience preferred.
  • Experience in financial modeling.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
  • Strong oral and written communication skills.
  • Strong project management skills with the ability to prioritize and manage daily tasks.

Benefits

  • The compensation range is $10,000 -- $12,500 per month, depending on experience and location.
  • Interns can be remote, though there is a preference for this role to be in the New York City or Santa Monica Office. Ideally, the intern would commit to being in the office 3+ days out of the week between Monday through Thursday.
  • We provide a monthly stipend for out-of-area interns working in NYC or LA.
  • We offer a temporary remote set-up for your home & free catered lunches whenever you are in the office.

results.title: Marketing & Communications Intern
results.description:
We’re looking for a creative, hands-on Marketing Intern to support our Brand and Communications team.

Are you 24/7 scrolling through social media? Are you known for always being up to date on the latest trends and influencers? Are you already thinking that this job ad would have worked better as a video?
Smiler is a brand that is driven by the need to create – we’re capturing hundreds of photos every hour, for thousands of people around the world, all in an effort to preserve the moments that matter most.
That’s why we’re looking for a young gun that is driven by the same obsessive need to ideate, create and generate. Whether it’s words, videos or visuals, this is more than just making sure the pixels are perfect or the grammar is great. If your brain is like a firehose of ideas, you’re passionate about travel and/or photography, and you’re still reading this after that firehose brain metaphor, we would love to hear from you.
This role will have the opportunity to shape, build and execute global communication campaigns as part of the team that develops, coordinates and executes Smiler’s marketing and communications worldwide.

 

What will you do:

  • Work as part of our Brand team to develop content concepts and strategies for customer and photographer audiences

  • Come up with creative still and video concepts for Instagram, TikTok, Linkedin and Facebook

  • Act as guardian and protector of our social media accounts and engage with our audience

  • Respond to queries via our social media channels

  • Research, identify and approach key influencers who are in line with our brand identity

  • Help establish brand partnerships

  • Find new creative opportunities to grow our channels even more

  • Plan, write and source imagery for daily content

  • Roll up your sleeves and get hands-on with various other types of content, such as articles, infographics, case studies, newsletters and other marketing materials

  • Support the team with other content and marketing tasks, such as brand and marketing, community management, Online Travel Agencies and more

Requirements:

  • Enrolled final year student in Communications, Marketing or similar relevant education

  • Experience with design software including Canva and/or Adobe

  • Excellent written and grammatical skills in English. Knowledge of other European languages would be muy bueno / wünderbar / lekker

  • Strategic, creative and conceptual mindset

  • A genuine hunger for development, keen to chase after opportunities when you identify a chance to make an impact and get involved

  • A creative and analytical mind that knows how to make things happen and seize content opportunities when they come your way

  • Good communication skills, a flair for storytelling, and knowledge of how to target specific audiences

 

What we’re offering

  • An empowered role with real responsibilities

  • A platform to showcase your strategic thinking and creative output

  • The opportunity to play a part in shaping our content and audience engagement strategy

  • A flexible working environment as a work-from-anywhere company

  • A warm company culture - we are inclusive, social, and happy to help you grow

  • An excellent learning environment - you will get first-hand experience of the role and we’ll guide you through your journey

  • A potential full-time role depending on your performance after your internship

 

Does this sound like the challenge you’re looking for?

Apply by clicking the apply button, fill in the online form, attach your CV and make a short (selfie) video to explain why you are the best hire for this role. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us at careers@joinsmiler.com.

 

Here’s what happens after you send your application:

You’ll receive an email confirmation confirming our hiring department has received your application. And an update will follow as to what the next stage of this adventure will be for you

More information on our website www.joinsmiler.com

 

About Smiler:

We believe that valuable memories deserve to be captured in high quality. It’s our mission to achieve that on a global scale for everyone. We are the world’s first on-the-spot photography marketplace that brings photographers and consumers together at tourist hotspots and other leisure locations. Globally, we are one of the most ambitious and fastest-growing startups to achieve international scale at lightning speed. We are already live on 3 continents, 70 countries, and over 670 cities, and we need your help to expand further!

results.title: Software Engineering Intern (Summer 2023)
results.description:
A Software Engineering Intern at Breadware will assist in developing internal tools such as test automation, documentation, and web and mobile app features. The projects worked on will be dependent on the intern’s skill level and interests. They will work closely with the software engineering team. The team member in this role will be mentored in exercising independent judgment and is encouraged to think outside the box to implement innovative solutions for challenging requirements. This position is fully remote and reports to software engineer Kaylee Bement. The software engineering internship pays $20 hourly, which estimates to be roughly $8,000 to $12,000 for the duration of the internship. This is a summer internship with an estimated start date between May and June.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS

Core Responsibilities:

  • Develop internal tools in collaboration with the software engineering team
  • Assist in writing and maintaining documentation
  • Take initiative in identifying and addressing unforeseen project needs and challenges

Team Participation:

  • Participate in code reviews
  • Be receptive to diverse team ideas and collaborate on the creation of new products and features
  • Document and communicate design decisions to team members

General:

  • Track and record engineering time, by project, using timekeeping software

Requirements

  • Be located in the United States
  • Must be a current student (either at a college or a CS bootcamp)
  • 1+ year(s) of relevant software design experience, independently or as part of a degree program from an accredited college or university
  • Working knowledge of MS Office software
  • Experience in at least one modern programming language: e.g. Python, JavaScript, C++

 

OTHER INFORMATION

  • This position is fully remote (within the United States) and pays $20 hourly, which estimates to be roughly $8,000 to $12,000 for the duration of the internship.
  • We value the diversity of the people we hire and serve. Diversity at our company means fostering a workplace in which individual differences are recognized, appreciated, respected, and responded to in ways that fully develop and utilize each person’s talents and strengths.
  • Research shows that women and underrepresented groups often apply to open roles only if they meet 100% of the listed criteria. We encourage everyone — including women, people of color, individuals with disabilities and those in the LGBTQIA+ community — to apply for our available positions, even if they don’t necessarily check every box on the job description.

results.title: Customer Support Internship
results.description:
Internship Customer Support

Are you looking for an internship where you really work as part of the team and are directly given your own areas of responsibility? Do you have a passion for travelling and would you like to work in an international team? Then apply now!

For Goboony, the leading camper sharing platform in Europe, we are looking for an intern for our support team in Germany. In the support team, you will learn everything about the structure of customer service in an international company. Together with your German and international colleagues, you will be the first point of contact for our renters and travellers.

 

This is what your day at Goboony could look like:

We do everything we can to offer our users a good service. This is also an important aspect in which we differentiate ourselves from others! As a Customer Service Intern at Goboony you will do more than just answer questions. You will be continuously involved in improving the customer journey of our users and helping Goboony to maintain high service standards.

Your tasks will include:

  • Answering questions via email, phone or WhatsApp.

  • Helping users resolve a claim or conflict.

  • Helping new advertisers to rent out their motorhome.

  • Ensuring that payments are processed smoothly.

  • Identify areas for improvement based on your own findings and feedback from users.

 

Get to know some of your future colleagues here!
Team

The team works partly remotely, in one of our co-working offices or in our head office in the centre of Utrecht. You will work closely with the Support Manager, the Country Manager and the Support and Supply teams.

What do you bring to the table?
  • You have excellent communication skills not only in English, but also in the language of the team you will be working for (German).
  • The customer comes first for you and you work in a solution-oriented way.
  • You are flexible, self-reliant and have a positive energy.
  • You are resilient and can work well under pressure.
  • You are available 24-40 hours per week.

 

 

What we offer

This is your chance to become part of the fastest growing RV sharing company in Europe! We offer an exciting job in a young, fast growing, dynamic and international scale-up.

  • Freedom! That's what we stand for. Freedom to develop your own ideas, to show initiative, to take responsibility and to develop yourself.
  • A responsible role in an ambitious team, at the forefront of our rapid growth.
  • Remote working with world-class tools and our website with in-house development.
  • A camping work trip with the team.
  • A young and international team.
  • We'll give you a €250 travel credit so you can take a camping trip yourself to experience freedom.
  • We don't count holidays. We believe in responsibility for your job, your personal life and a healthy combination of both. We recommend taking at least 25 days. But you can plan your work and free time as it suits you.
  • Many opportunities for personal development.

Interested?
Apply now!

For questions, please contact gwendolyn@goboony.com

results.title: Beck-End Software Developer(Mobile Games)
results.description:
PerBlue is offering opportunities for passionate Software Developer Interns to join our team of experienced engineers and game designers. We’re a growing independent studio whose free-to-play midcore mobile games have been played by millions people around the world, including our award-winning Disney Heroes: Battle Mode.

Our cross-functional and collaborative team has experience across the videogame industry. Headquartered in Madison, Wisconsin, we also offer remote work within the United States for an unmatched quality of life and work.

Our available internships are for Front-End, Game Engine, and Back-End developers for the summer of 2023. You'll work on real games, ship real code, and have real responsibilities. You’ll be embedded on a production team where you'll work side-by-side with engineers on a cross-functional team working on large distributed server systems, network stacks, game mechanics, artificial intelligence, client side development, and user interface implementations.  

 

 

Key responsibilities - Back-End Developers

As a Software Developer Intern in a Back-End role, you'll be responsible for implementing backend systems that support our suite of cross-platform mobile games. You’ll solve big, complex technical problems and build highly scalable systems and servers that are able to handle TBs of data and thousands of simultaneous network connections to serve our games to large user bases.

 

Requirements—

  • Java or C# programming background
  • A passion for all things programming with amazing technical skills
  • Desire and willingness to learn new technology and tools
  • Be results-oriented and able to thrive in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong focus on product and an eye for quality
  • Completion of interesting side projects
  • Self-motivation, self-direction, and strong remote communication skills as this will be a remote-first opportunity

 

Other qualifications—

  • Familiar with Unity or other engines
  • An interest and passion for gaming
  • Ability to effectively communicate with team-members and management
  • Prior experience at a game studio (mobile, console, or PC)
  • Previously shipped a mobile app or multiplayer game

 

If you’re thinking that your past experiences don’t meet every single one of our requirements and preferences perfectly, please still consider applying for this role. We seek diversity in people, experiences, and perspectives, and we’re committed to building a genuine, diverse, and inclusive workplace. If you clicked into this posting and you’re excited about this role, you may just be the candidate we’re looking for, so go on and apply!  

 

Perks

This is a full time, paid position for the summer of 2023. Our interns have a great work environment where you’ll work on live games. You'll also be able to participate in our remote lunch program, get mentorship from experienced mobile game devs, and more!

No agencies, please. This is a pretty good description of this position but is not a complete job description, so responsibilities and supervisors may change. We regret that we cannot consider visa sponsorship or candidates based outside of the United States and Canada for this position at this time.

results.title: Sales Intern
results.description:
Web Scribble provides market-leading, innovative career center software to thousands of customers and hundreds of associations around the world. Associations depend on Web Scribble's job board software to provide clear member value, develop deep member insight and enhanced engagement, connect talented and qualified job seekers with the right employers, drive non-dues revenue, and advance shared missions. Web Scribble is currently in a high growth phase – growing 480% over the last three years – and was recently named to the Inc. 5000 list of the fastest-growing private companies in America.

We are looking for a paid Sales Intern to work with our Team Lead on connecting with inbound employers, answering inbound phone calls, responding to chat messages, and scheduling appointments for salespeople.

Key Responsibilities

  • Staff our inbound chat, answering questions for net new employers on e-commerce job postings
  • Answer inbound phone calls, explaining Web Scribble’s recruitment advertising offers
  • Use Salesforce and website research to determine employer size and category
  • Direct employers to the proper salesperson or assist the employer directly
  • Clearly articulate and demonstrate our value proposition, creating excitement and enthusiasm among prospects.
  • Learn about employers’ hiring needs and company hiring initiatives.

Requirements

  • Familiarity or interest in sales, recruitment advertising, or human resources
  • Some customer service experience preferred
  • Available at least 20 hours per week

Benefits

This is a paid internship.

Web Scribble is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that diversity is integral to our success, and do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, age, or any other basis protected by law.

results.title: Junior Technical Support Agent Intern
results.description:
Our job everyday is to protect the data and critical assets of businesses world-wide by discovering hidden vulnerabilities… before the bad guys do!

At CybelAngel, we see beyond perimeters to protect businesses from the most critical cybersecurity threats. Fortune 500 Global to mid-size companies world-wide, trust CybelAngel’s global team of approximately 200 team members to protect their businesses from digital threats. With a combination of advanced machine learning, cyber analysis expertise, and a powerful suite of software solutions, CybelAngel detects and resolves our clients potential threats, long before they can fall into the hands of cyber criminals.

Our capabilities expand every day to uncover new risks, detect more threats, protect more clients, and create new possibilities for our employees.

With offices in Boston, Paris, and London, CybelAngel’s global footprint allows for a thriving hybrid, office and remote-work environment. We are looking for exceptional ‘go-getters’ who share our ambitious vision, innovative culture, high commitment to ethics, and enthusiasm for being the best possible place to work!

Our values:

  • Be Bold
  • Be Curious
  • Stronger Together

JOB DESCRIPTION

We’re looking for a talented technical support agent intern who takes pleasure in solving complex problems while interacting with customers. You should apply to this position if you are versatile, keen on new technologies, and you want to improve your skills under our supervision.

Technical Support Team

  • A 5-person team made-up of one manager, one team leader, one support ops specialist and two support agents will provide you with a qualified and personalized training
  • A rapid evolution to Tier-2 and Tier-3 ticket management, with highly specialized issues to handle, is a guarantee that you will not be bored down to handling Tier-1 tickets only

Your responsibilities

  • Provide quality support to tickets created by customers, partners and inhouse users
  • Investigate and escalate problems quickly
  • Update self-service and internal knowledge base
  • Assist Support team in its recurring tasks
  • Collaborate with Analyst, Engineering, and Product teams to help improve our service

Requirements

Your preferred experience

Soft skills

  • Excellent communication skills
  • Curiosity
  • Eagerness to learn
  • Ability to challenge yourself

Hard skills

  • Level of education: Bac +2 minimum
  • Fluent in French and English (spoken and written)
  • Technological background (ideally computer training)
  • Knowledge of how web applications work

Bonus experience

  • Coding experience or skills
  • Help Center support or customer support training or experience
  • Knowledge of how to use web browser’s debugging tools
  • Knowledge of Zendesk

If you do not meet the requirements but you think you are a great fit, you are welcome to apply and explain why !

 

Benefits

Our Engineering Culture

🗃️ Small teams & short iterations

🤝 Culture of sharing, pair and mod programming, when it makes sense

👩‍🎨 Quality time dedicated to technical design

🧙‍♂️Half the software engineers have over 10 years of experience

🎒 Voyager Program to change team temporarily and discover how they work #becurious

✌️ Cooldown week dedicated to learning and experimenting

🤼 Whole team buildings each semester #strongertogether

🧠 Career path & trainings #bebold

📍 Remote options from everywhere in France (but you can come to our amazing office near Parc Monceau whenever you want, and it's paid by the company up to once a month)

Our Benefits

💰 Salary : 1200 euros a month

👊6-month internship contract (“convention de stage”) and possibility to extend to a permanent contract at the end

💛 Very friendly and benevolent atmosphere with parties (CEO is an ex-DJ), sport sessions, board games nights, music band…

👊🏻 DE&I group

🌍 Green team

🥓 Free English Courses

🏋🏾‍♀️ Class Pass credits for your gym sessions

90% of our People recommend CybelAngel

92% are happy with the work life balance at CybelAngel

Your hiring journey with us

  • 30’ call with Pierre, Recruiter, to discuss about expectations from both ends
  • 30’ call with Jaïs, Global Technical Support Manager, to discuss context and projects and to evaluate fit and tech skills
  • 120’ call with Jaïs and Xavier, Technical Support Team Leader, to assess both your soft skills and hard skills

results.title: Graphic Designer
results.description:

You will help out with defining requirements, visualizing and creating graphics including illustrations, logos, layouts and photos. You’ll be the one to help us shape the visual aspects of websites, books, magazines, product packaging, exhibitions and more. Your graphics should capture the attention of those who see them and communicate the right message. For this, you need to have a creative flair and a strong ability to translate requirements into design. If you can communicate well and work methodically as part of a team, we’d like to meet you. The goal is to inspire and attract the target audience.

 

Responsibilities
  • Prepare images to coincide with social and blog posts
  • Assist with website and blog updates
  • Assist with collateral updates and version control
  • Creation of various logos for products
  • Assist with video production (shooting, editing, etc)
  • Other projects as assigned

Requirements

  • Graphic designing experience
  • Familiarity with design software and technologies (such as InDesign, Illustrator, Dreamweaver, Photoshop)
  • A strong portfolio of illustrations or other graphics
  • A keen eye for aesthetics and details
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Ability to work methodically and meet deadlines
  • Able to work well under pressure

Benefits

Benefits

  • ‘Work from wherever’ policy
  • Frequent team events & quarterly social gatherings
  • Great culture
  • Fun, collaborative team where no idea is too big or too small!

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

We're committed to growing and empowering a more inclusive community within our company, industry, and cities. That's why we hire and cultivate diverse teams of the best and brightest from all backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives.
